title: Secrets Management
description: Secrets Management checklist for CI/CD and DevSecOps assessments

categories.description: Best practices and controls applicable to any environment handling secrets.

items.item: Minimize the time secrets stay in memory; apply memory protection/zeroing when practical
Enforce identity-based access controls (IBAC), with least privilege across all secrets
Ensure that secrets are never transmitted or stored in plaintext; always use TLS
Audit all secret-related activity: creation, access, change, deletion
Implement fine-grained access control and policies for secrets management
Store all secrets in a secure, centralized location (no hardcoding/secrets sprawl)
Standardize secrets lifecycle: creation, rotation, revocation, expiration
Automate secrets provisioning, rotation, and revocation wherever possible

categories.description: Controls and practices for secrets in automated pipelines and CI/CD workflows.

items.item: Backup and secure critical secrets independently from pipeline systems
Scan for unsecured secrets in repositories and CI/CD environments
Ensure pipeline output and logs never leak secret values
Restrict CI/CD tooling/service accounts to only the secrets and environments they require
Automate the injection, rotation, and revocation of secrets in pipelines
Monitor and log all secret access in CI/CD, with attribution to users/services

categories.description: Requirements for managing secrets across cloud providers and distributed systems.

items.item: Use native secrets management services from cloud providers where possible
Clearly distinguish and document secrets by environment, project, or role
Integrate secrets management with IAM for attribution and access tracking
Automate secret replication, backup, and restore across regions for continuity

categories.description: Approaches for identifying risks and responding to secret exposures.

items.item: Automate notification, revocation, and rotation in case of exposed secrets
Continuously scan codebases and systems for exposed or hardcoded secrets
Document incident response playbooks for common secret leakage scenarios
Have clear policies and documentation for managing secret exposure incidents
Enable detailed audit logging and alerting for abnormal secrets activity

categories.description: Practices for handling cryptographic keys, certificates, and PKI secrets.

items.item: Centralize certificate and key management with visibility across platforms
Use client-side encryption and Bring Your Own Key (BYOK) where needed
Standardize PKI management and automate certificate issuance and renewal
Store encryption keys separately from encrypted data
Document all certificate/key usage and rotation; have expiration policies

categories.description: Considerations for secrets management in hybrid/multi-cloud and large-scale contexts.

items.item: Separate secrets by team, project, and environment (namespaces/policies)
Monitor and tune secrets management as environments scale
Protect continuity with secret replication and redundancy across regions
Support secret management workflows that span public/private/hybrid cloud
